business.headline: Switzerland cancels 'most favoured nation' status to India over Nestle ruling The Swiss government has suspended the MFN clause in its tax treaty with India, potentially leading to higher taxes on Indian companies operating in Switzerland. This move follows a Supreme Court ruling affecting the interpretation of the MFN clause.
Bill Gates to go bankrupt? Tesla CEO Elon Musk explains howElon Musk claims Bill Gates could face bankruptcy over his alleged Tesla short position if the company dominates globally.
Uncovered: Network of suspected scam sites lure 'dabba' tradersIndia Today uncovers a web of suspected scammer sites posing as platforms for the "dabba" stock trade, an illegal practice.

Oh Gary, how could you: Elon Musk mocks US body amid Twitter stock probeA letter from Elon Musk's attorney, Alex Spiro, addressed to outgoing US Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) Chair Gary Gensler, alleged that the agency gave Musk a 48-hour ultimatum.
Sensex, Nifty rebound to end higher; FMCG and IT stocks lead recoveryThe S&P BSE Sensex gained 843.16 points to close at 82,133.12, while the NSE Nifty50 added 219.60 points to end at 24,768.30.
EPFO key amendments: Now faster claims and more interest benefits for membersEPFO's amendments focus on reducing delays, quicker claims, and better interest benefits for its members.

Sensex gains 700 points: 3 reasons behind stock market volatility todayStock market rebound: The S&P BSE Sensex was up 730.39 points to 82,020.35, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 192.70 points to 24,741.40, as of 3 PM.

Mobikwik IPO listing: Does GMP suggest strong market debut amid heavy demand?Mobikwik IPO has seen very strong demand among investors and was fully booked within the first hour of opening for subscription.
Sensex back in green: Airtel, HUL, and IT stocks lead market rebound As of 12:52 PM, Sensex was up by 111.46 points to 81,401.42, while Nifty50 gained 12.75 points to 24,561.45.

Vishal Mega Mart IPO last day: Check gmp, subscription. Shoud you subscribe?Vishal Mega Mart IPO has set a price range of Rs 74 to Rs 78 per share. Retail investors need to purchase a minimum of 190 shares in a single lot, requiring an initial investment of Rs 14,820.
Azim Premji, Ranjan Pai to buy a minority stake in Akasa Air: ReportAzim Premji and Ranjan Pai family offices acquired a minority stake in Akasa Air as part of a $130-140 million fundraising round.
Explained: Why a credit score over 800 mattersHigh credit scores boost financial health by offering cheaper loans, and better insurance discounts, amongst others.

Gold, silver price today, December 13, 2024: Precious metals witness dip on MCXGold Price Today December 13, 2024: Both gold and silver are trading on the lower side of the Multi Commodity Exchange (MCX) on Friday. Check the latest city-wise prices here.

Sensex falls 1,000 points: Key factors behind stock market weaknessStock market crash: As of 10:37 AM, the Sensex was down 1,064.37 points to 80,225.59, while Nifty was also struggling below 24,300 losing 332.10 points to 24,216.60.
Sensex, Nifty tank in early trade; inflation relief fails to lift market moodThe S&P BSE Sensex was down 540.09 points to 80,749.87, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 160.35 points to 24,388.35.

Mahila Samman Yojana: Key details about Rs 1000 schemeThe AAP government announced Mahila Samman Yojana, offering Rs 1000 monthly to women in Delhi, with a rise to Rs 2100 if it wins in the upcoming elections.

Retail inflation cools to 5.48% in November from 6.21% in OctoberHouseholds across the world's most populous country are likely to welcome the inflation relief, given that food expenses dominate many family budgets.
Sensex, Nifty end lower ahead of inflation data; bearish trend persistsThe S&P BSE Sensex lost 236.18 points to close at 81,289.96, while the Nifty50 was down 93.10 points to end at 24,548.70.
December 15 advance tax deadline: What you need to knowTaxpayers with liabilities exceeding Rs 10,000 are required to make quarterly advance tax payments to avoid penalties and interest charges.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Haryana cops use tear gas, water cannons as farmers try to march to DelhiHaryana police fired tear gas shells and used water cannons on protesting farmers at Shambhu border as they tried to march to Delhi. The farmers began their march, marking their third attempt to enter the capital.

South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol impeached over short-lived martial lawThousands of protesters gathered outside the National Assembly in Seoul as lawmakers voted to impeach President Yoon Suk Yeol, who has faced mounting calls to step down since his short-lived martial law declaration.

Kiren Rijiju's dig at Congress: They avoided roads near border to stop encroachmentKiren Rjiju claimed that Congress did not want to build proper roads in the border areas as they feared that the initiative could facilitate the passage of army personnel from the neighbouring country into the frontier state.

3rd Test: Rain turns villain on Day 1 after another debatable Rohit Sharma callBorder-Gavaskar Trophy: Rain washed out Day 1 of the Brisbane Test after India won the toss and decided to bowl in the third Test. Rohit Sharma's decision to bowl didn't yield the right results in the end, as Australia's openers negated the early threat from the India pacers.

Proposal for ban on film reviews: Threat to freedom of expression or desperation?Recently, the Tamil Film Active Producers Association (TFAPA) filed a writ petition in the Madras High Court calling for a ban on movie reviews on social media for three days since release. Can movie reviews make or break a film's theatrical run?

Allu Arjun says stampede was unfortunate, 'not in my control' after leaving jailActor Allu Arjun said he would cooperate with authorities in the stampede case after walking out of a Hyderabad jail, where he spent the night following his arrest a day before.

Didn't win any war, just made film: Revanth Reddy scoffs at row over Allu ArjunDuring Agenda Aaj Tak, Telangana Chief Minister Revanth Reddy while talking about Allu Arjun's arrest, said, "I am a star myself, I am no one's fan."

World Champion D Gukesh reacts to Magnus Carlsen's criticism of Ding Liren matchD Gukesh has reacted to the criticism from Magnus Carlsen about his World Chess Championship match against Ding Liren in Singapore. Carlsen questioned the quality of the match, which saw Gukesh become crowned as the new World Champion.

Raj Kapoor's 100th birth anniversary: PM celebrates legacy of 'eternal showman'PM Narendra Modi paid tribute to Raj Kapoor on his 100th birth anniversary, calling him a visionary filmmaker and cultural ambassador. Modi highlighted Kapoor's impact on Indian cinema and his global legacy.

Arvind Kejriwal lists 3 promises he couldn't fulfil in 5 yearsIn a candid admission, Arvind Kejriwal said he was unable to fulfil promises due to two reasons: the Covid-19 pandemic and AAP leaders, including himself being jailed.

Kangana Ranaut bashes Priyanka Gandhi's 'weak' debut speech: Can't fool peopleBJP MP Kangana Ranaut contrasted Priyanka Gandhi's speech with Home Minister Rajnath Singh's address, stating that the former's speech was "rooted in data and facts" while the latter's was merely "random allegations."

'Has Trump been ruling India?' Sanjay Singh vs Manoj Tiwari on illegal immigrantsBJP MP Manoj Tiwari and AAP MP Sanjay Singh, speaking at Agenda Aaj Tak, were involved in a fiery war of words over illegal immigration of Bangladeshi Rohingyas and discrepancies in voter lists.

Another day, another tantrum. How to manage your child's anger and stubbornnessEvery parent knows the struggle when their child throws a fit after being told 'no'. It's frustrating, and while you know this behaviour isn't healthy, how should you handle it?
OpenAI whistleblower Suchir Balaji found dead in San Francisco apartmentSuchir Balaji, a whistleblower who formerly worked at AI giant OpenAI, was found dead in his apartment in San Francisco.

No one's asking about stampede victim: Revanth Reddy on Allu Arjun's arrestSpeaking at the Agenda Aaj Tak event, Telangana Chief Minister Revanth Reddy claimed that the police were doing their job but Allu Arjun's arrival at the theatre for the premiere without any intimation to the management as well as the police, had led to the stampede.

Not swinging: Stump mic catches frustrated Jasprit Bumrah on Day 1 of 3rd TestA frustrated Jasprit Bumrah was caught on the stump mic, saying that there was no swing on offer on Day 1 of the 3rd Test on Saturday, December 14. The first day's play of the Brisbane Test was called off due to rain.

In China, hiring 'climbing buddies' for treks is the latest trendHiring "climbing buddies" has become the latest trend in China, with people paying for companions to guide and motivate them on mountain treks. Read on to know more.

Trump vows to abolish daylight saving time in US: 'Inconvenient, very costly'US President-elect Donald Trump said his Republican Party will "use its best efforts" to end the practice of adjusting clocks twice a year, calling daylight saving time "inconvenient" and "very costly" to Americans.

Allu Arjun hugs emotional wife, kisses daughter after returning home Actor Allu Arjun returned home after his release from Chanchalguda Jail on Saturday. He received an emotional welcome from his family. He thanked fans for their support and vowed to cooperate with the law.

Rashmika Mandanna defends toxic masculinity in Pushpa 2, Animal: It's human natureActor Rashmika Mandanna addressed the criticism of toxic masculinity in Pushpa 2 and Animal, explaining that such traits exist in real life and that cinema takes creative liberties to entertain audiences.

BJP MP Tejasvi Surya slams Congress, accuses party of giving away Kachchatheevu IslandPrime Minister Narendra Modi is expected to reply to the debate on the 75th anniversary of the Constitution in the Lok Sabha on Saturday. The Lower House of Parliament initiated a two-day debate on the Constitution on December 13 to commemorate the beginning of the 75th year of its adoption. Earlier on Friday, the debate on the Constitution witnessed fiery speeches by Defence Minister Rajnath Singh and Wayanad MP Priyanka Gandhi. Follow India Today for all the latest updates from Parliament.

BJP veteran LK Advani hospitalised, third time this year; condition stableLK Advani was admitted to Apollo Hospital in Delhi for a routine check-up. The 96-year-old BJP veteran's condition is stable, and he remains under observation.

Red One review: Chris Evans' film is a fun yet flawed festive flickRed One review: Chris Evans' film promises a thrilling blend of action and holiday cheer. Despite its star power, the film struggles to maintain its festive spark.

Tim Southee receives guard of honour in farewell Test against EnglandVeteran New Zealand pacer Tim Southee received a guard of honour from the England team on the first day of the third Test in Hamilton. New Zealand were 315 for 9 at stumps on the first day of the third Test against England.

Shakib Al Hasan banned from bowling by ECB after action deemed illegalShakib Al Hasan, Bangladesh's star all-rounder, has been suspended from bowling in ECB competitions due to an illegal action. This decision could affect his international career and participation in other tournaments.

Gabba hero Rishabh Pant recalls 'challenging part' during recovery from accidentIndia wicketkeeper Rishabh Pant revealed the most challenging part during his recovery process after his accident in 2022. Pant has been back behind the stumps for India in Tests and has done well with the bat as well.

AUS vs IND, 3rd Test: Harshit Rana and R Ashwin dropped as India make 2 changes to XIIndia have decided to drop Harshit Rana and R Ashwin for the Brisbane Test with Ravindra Jadeja and Akash Deep coming into the playing XI. India won the toss on Day 1 of the Test on Saturday, December 14.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
